title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 160.1 - Purpose and general description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 5 ยง 160.1 - Purpose and general description

State Regulations

The Excelsior Linked Deposit Program authorizes the

Comptroller to deposit State funds and the Commissioner of Taxation and Finance
to deposit funds of public authorities and public benefit corporations with
participating banks, thrifts, farm credit system institutions, and the New York

Business Development Corporation at a reduced rate of return when such banks, thrifts, farm credit system institutions, and the New York Business Development

Corporation make lower cost loans, on the basis of such linked deposits, to
qualifying businesses to improve productivity, competitiveness, access to new
markets, and exporting capabilities. The Commissioner of Economic Development
is charged with administering the program. The purpose of these regulations is
to set forth the eligibility requirements and application procedures for
participation by businesses and banks and thrifts in the
program. Notes

160.1

Amended

New

York State Register January 6, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 01, eff. 1/6/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
